snippet.title: James Starks to visit with the Pittsburgh Steelers Monday
snippet.description: The Green Bay Packers spent most of the first week of free agency re-signing their own players. One they didn't lock up is running back James Starks . A source told the Journal Sentinel that Starks, 28, will visit the Pittsburgh Steelers on Monday. Last season,

snippet.title: NFL tells Steelers they won't lose draft pick
snippet.description: PITTSBURGH (AP) Pittsburgh Steelers president Art Rooney II says the NFL has told the team it will not be docked a pick in this year's draft for coach Mike Tomlin's foray onto the field against Baltimore last November. snippet.title: Box score: Steelers 35, Chargers 24
snippet.description: There is a home-field advantage in the NFL playoffs after all, and it belongs to the Pittsburgh Steelers.

snippet.title: Steelers 38, Packers 31
snippet.description: Photos from Lambeau Field as the Green Bay Packers hosted the Pittsburgh Steelers on Sunday afternoon.

snippet.title: SUPER BOWL: Steelers 27, Cardinals 23 | TD catch by Holmes helps Pittsburgh win a thriller
snippet.description: Santonio Holmes caught a six-yard touchdown pass with 35 seconds left to cap one of the best fourth quarters in Super Bowl history, giving the Pittsburgh Steelers a thrilling 27-23 victory over the Arizona Cardinals. SUPER BOWL: Steelers 27, Cardinals

snippet.title: Steelers notes | Rodgers has the attention, and the respect, of Pittsburgh
snippet.description: The Pittsburgh Steelers got their first up-close look at Aaron Rodgers in 2009, when the Green Bay Packers' quarterback threw for 383 yards and three touchdowns against them. snippet.title: Instant replay: the last Packers-Steelers game
snippet.description: As a service to our football fans, here is the link to the Dec. 20, 2009 game between the Green Bay Packers and the Pittsburgh Steelers. First, the Journal Sentinel story. And the game story from the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette .

snippet.title: Packers sign Steelers safety Smith
snippet.description: The Packers are on the free-agent board: They agreed to terms today on a contract with Pittsburgh Steelers safety Anthony Smith, a league source said. Terms of the deal were not immediately
